subject: Football
lead_paragraph: The suspended Titans cornerback Pacman Jones can appear at a wrestling event today but cannot compete in the ring under an agreement approved by a judge.The Titans, Jones and the wrestling promoters worked out an arrangement Friday night in which the player would be part of the pay-per-view show “Hard Justice.” The deal was approved yesterday, including a temporary injunction that prohibits Jones from doing anything in which he could hurt himself.On Friday, the Tennessee Titans sought a restraining order barring Jones from participating in the show in any way. The Titans cited a contract that prevents him from engaging in activities in which he could be injured.Jones was suspended by the N.F.L. for a year because of repeated conduct violations since being drafted in 2005.
